pullRequest.body:
We introduce a class on covers containing the data of structure morphisms over a base and provide basic constructions.

---

### PR summary [f6c4ab7dbc](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19096/commits/f6c4ab7dbc562ab107bc181ea8d1b771effff17c)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Cover.Over` (new file)|1820|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Cover.Over`
`+ Cover.pullbackCoverOver`
`+ Cover.pullbackCoverOver'`
`+ Cover.pullbackCoverOverProp`
`+ Cover.pullbackCoverOverProp'`
`+ Hom.asOver`
`+ Hom.asOverProp`
`+ OverClass.asOverHom`
`+ OverClass.fromOver`
`+ asOver`
`+ asOverProp`
`+ instance (j : (ùí∞.bind ùí±).J) : ((ùí∞.bind ùí±).obj j).Over S`
`+ instance (j : ùí∞.J) : ((ùí∞.pullbackCoverOver S f).obj j).Over S`
`+ instance (j : ùí∞.J) : ((ùí∞.pullbackCoverOver' S f).obj j).Over S`
`+ instance (j : ùí∞.J) : ((ùí∞.pullbackCoverOverProp S f hX hW hQ).obj j).Over S`
`+ instance (j : ùí∞.J) : ((ùí∞.pullbackCoverOverProp' S f hX hW hQ).obj j).Over S`
`+ instance : (Over.forget P ‚ä§ X).Faithful := inferInstanceAs <| (Comma.forget _ _ _ _ _).Faithful`
`+ instance : (Over.forget P ‚ä§ X).Full := inferInstanceAs <| (Comma.forget _ _ _ _ _).Full`
`+ instance : (Under.forget P ‚ä§ X).Faithful := inferInstanceAs <| (Comma.forget _ _ _ _ _).Faithful`
`+ instance : (Under.forget P ‚ä§ X).Full := inferInstanceAs <| (Comma.forget _ _ _ _ _).Full`
`+ instance : (ùí∞.pullbackCoverOver S f).Over S`
`+ instance : (ùí∞.pullbackCoverOver' S f).Over S`
`+ instance : (ùí∞.pullbackCoverOverProp S f hX hW hQ).Over S`
`+ instance : (ùí∞.pullbackCoverOverProp' S f hX hW hQ).Over S`
`+ instance [P.ContainsIdentities] [P.RespectsIso] {X Y : Scheme.{u}} (f : X ‚ü∂ Y) [X.Over S] [Y.Over S]`
`+ instance {S : C} {X Y : Over S} (f : X ‚ü∂ Y) : HomIsOver f.left S`
`+ instance {X : Scheme.{u}} (ùí∞ : X.Cover P) (ùí± : ‚àÄ x, (ùí∞.obj x).Cover P)`
`+ mem_range_iff_of_surjective`
`+ range_eq_range_of_surjective`
`+ range_eq_univ`
`+ toCommaMorphism_eq_hom`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Thanks!

bors d+

:v: chrisflav can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks for the review!

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12014284941/job/33489719658)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12014284941/job/33489720246)
Why can't we use `AlgebraicGeometry.Scheme.Cover.pullbackCover` instead?

In #18945 I use these to define a pretopology on `Over S`, for which I need to show that pullbacks of coverings are coverings. This involves an `=` of presieves and so `Cover.pullbackCover` is not sufficient I think, because of the non def-eq issue described in the comment. (I of course only need the primed versions, but I added the others for completeness). Should I add to the docstring that these should typically not be used?

I would also think it would be much better it we could avoid reproving 4 times that a pullback of a cover is a cover. Is not it possible to prove that if `X : I ‚Üí Scheme` and `Y : I ‚Üí Scheme` are isomorphic families of schemes over a certain scheme `S`, then `X` covers `S` iff `Y` does (whether this is phrased in `Scheme`, the `Over S` categories or their variants with morphism properties). Then, presumably, you may transport the property that a family is covering by using the comparison isomorphisms between the pullback in the various categories that are involved.
Thanks! I added something similar (without indices and for surjective morphisms) and this golfs the `covers` proofs quite nicely.

This generates the lemma `OverClass.asOver_hom`:
```suggestion
@[simps! hom left]
def OverClass.asOver [OverClass X S] : Over S := Over.mk (X ‚Üò S)
```
In general, you may try `@[simps?]` or `@[simps!?]` and hovering over to see the exact form of the automatically generated simp lemmas.

Similarly, you can do `@[simps! left] def OverClass.asOverHom ...`.
Changed. Could you tell me why here it is safe to have `asOver_left` as a `simp` lemma? (I wonder if it causes `motive not correct` type issues)

I am not sure I understand. Here, the simp lemmas are `dsimp` lemmas: they basically just unfold the definitions. We cannot always apply simp lemmas using the `rw` tactic (this may create `motive not correct` errors), but this does not happen with `simp` (and presumably `simp_rw`).

For example, the `coe_of` type lemmas like `CommRingCat.coe_of` are `dsimp` lemmas that cause a lot of `motive not correct`s, because the def-eq is not visible at reducible transparency. Indeed also here:
```
example [OverClass X S] : (OverClass.asOver X S).left = X := by
  with_reducible rfl
```
fails.
For now I am fine with adding `asOver_left` with `@[simp]`. We will see if this causes trouble in this case, I am just trying to be cautious with these `simp` lemmas that rewrite types.

Here, it would be better to do `@[simps] instance OverClass.fromOver`. This generates the same lemma as `fromOver_hom`, but with the name `fromOver_over` which should be the more correct name because of the line `initialize_simps_projections OverClass (hom ‚Üí over)` above in the same file.
It seems to me this docstring does not correspond to the actual content. It should be expanded similarly as `Cover.pullbackCoverOver`.

```suggestion
the pullback in `Over S`, whose underlying scheme is only isomorphic but not equal to the
```

```suggestion
the pullback in `Q.Over ‚ä§ S`, whose underlying scheme is only isomorphic but not equal to the
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry): covers of schemes over a base
